thread.title: MLS: NYC FC can't hold on - Soccer
thread.title_full: MLS: NYC FC can't hold on - Soccer - NorthJersey.com

author: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS |
title: MLS: NYC FC can't hold on - Soccer
text:
WASHINGTON — The winning streak is gone.
Alvaro Saborio knocked in a loose ball on a free kick in the 92nd minute and D.C. United beat New York City FC, 2-1, on a rainy Friday night to secure an Eastern Conference playoff spot.
NYC FC (10-15-7) had its three-game winning streak stopped. D.C. United (14-12-6) snapped its six-game winless stretch to move into a first-place tie with the Red Bulls. 
Frank Lampard opened the scoring in the first minute for the fastest goal in NYC FC’s first season. Bill Hamid blocked David Villa’s fast-break attempt and Lampard slotted the rebound for his third goal in his last four games.
Fabian Espindola tied it in the 73rd minute. A diving Josh Saunders got a hand on Chris Pontius’ shot and Espindola put in the rebound.
Villa sent a ball over the crossbar in the 41st and rolled one wide of the near post in first-half stoppage time.
